
### read/write  {.smaller}


```
ssize_t read(int fd, void *buffer, size_t count);
ssize_t write(int fd, void *buffer, size_t count);

```
 

* read/write [up to <i>count</i>]{.fragment fragment-index=2 .custom .myem-only} bytes to/from <i>buffer</i>
* returns number of bytes read/written or -1 on error 

   * ssize_t is a signed integer type
   * error code in <code>errno</code>

* read returning 0 means end-of-file (<i>not an error</i>) 

   * can read/write less than requested (end of file, broken I/O device, â€¦)
